metadata.name: Recon Command Output Piped To Findstr.EXE
metadata.comment: Detects the execution of a potential recon command where the results are piped to "findstr". This is meant to trigger on inline calls of "cmd.exe" via the "/c" or "/k" for example. Attackers often time use this technique to extract specific information they require in their reconnaissance phase.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND (lower(process.cmd_line) regexp '.*ipconfig.*|.*find.*' OR lower(process.cmd_line) regexp '.*net.*|.*find.*' OR lower(process.cmd_line) regexp '.*netstat.*|.*find.*' OR lower(process.cmd_line) regexp '.*ping.*|.*find.*' OR lower(process.cmd_line) regexp '.*systeminfo.*|.*find.*' OR lower(process.cmd_line) regexp '.*tasklist.*|.*find.*' OR lower(process.cmd_line) regexp '.*whoami.*|.*find.*'))

output.summary: Detects the execution of a potential recon command where the results are piped to "findstr". This is meant to trigger on inline calls of "cmd.exe" via the "/c" or "/k" for example. Attackers often time use this technique to extract specific information they require in their reconnaissance phase.
